paragraphs.body: Fire Nation coins are much more angular than their Earth Kingdom counterparts. They vary according to weight, size, and shape, though all have a nationalistic image on the reverse side and writing on the obverse. The copper piece is the least valuable and is a square with two concave sides. In its center is an image of a small flame. The gold piece is the longest and is mostly rectangular in shape with a long slit running from its base to a little below the top. The silver piece is the smallest and pentagonal in shape with the national emblem on one of its faces.
